title: Is it too late to file for Bankruptcy once you have received a summons for a credit card non payment?
question: I have an outstanding credit card with Capitol one and got a summons, I am getting ready to send them my formal general denial answer. I was wondering if it was too late to file for Bankruptcy once we are in court with this summons? Also can I hire a Bankruptcy attorney and make payments? since I don't have a lump sum of money to pay them.
answers: You can file BK at any time during court litigation with a creditor. The cost of defending yourself against a credit card debt can exceed the cost of a BK. Many attorneys are available for help, including me. I can work with you on a payment plan. Call me.

You can file a Bankruptcy case now. When you file, an Automatic stay goes into effect and the state court action is frozen while your bankruptcy case is pending. Contact a Bankruptcy attorney in your area to get more details.

You can file a bankruptcy anytime before the judgment is entered against you. It may be a good idea to file your answer to give you a little more time before you have to file your bankruptcy. Make sure if you do not file the answer that you file the bankruptcy before a default judgment is entered against you. My office will allow you to make payments on your fees. Please call to get details (310) 515-7799
It's not too late to file.

Not too late, in fact it might just be the best time. feel free to contact me if you have a question.

Rob
www.affordableattorneysgroup.com

No it is not too late to file a bankruptcy, but you should consult with a local bankruptcy attorney first in order to ascertain if you are able to file a bankruptcy. The consultation should be free and the attorney will tell you about the pricing and how they are willing to accept it.

It is not too late to file for BK. You may do so at any time and enjoy the protections of the automatic stay.

A BK attorney usually accepts payments for attorney fees. However, you must be paid in full prior to filing the BK. This is because BK attorneys/firms are considered debt relief agencies. One can't be a debt relief agency and a creditor at the same time.

Consult a BK attorney in your area ASAP.
Best of luck to you.
Not too late. Yes, most BK attorneys will accept payments for their fee. Good luck.

It is definitely not too late to file bankruptcy. As soon as you file bankruptcy, the creditor will be required to cease all collection efforts including the lawsuit they have filed against you. I would suggest contacting a bankruptcy attorney right away. Most bankruptcy attorneys offer a free consultation and many of us have flexible payment plans for the attorney fees.
A bankruptcy can be filed at any time even after you're in court. As for retaining an attorney you should contact them and ask them what type of payment plans they accept in your area.
